intro: Sanmartina marginata, commonly known as the margined sanmartina, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with a distinctive white margin, and its showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
